item.title: AI-Assisted Learning
item.description:
The Problem

AI coding tools are now table stakes. But recent research shows a 17% reduction in skill acquisition when used passively. The Active Prompting Protocol extracts the tactics used by high-performing developers in Anthropic’s study.

item.title: Deep Work: The Attention Foundation
item.description:
The Problem

You sit down to learn. Your environment is quiet, your coffee is fresh, your notes are organized. You begin reading. Five minutes in, a notification. You check it—thirty seconds, no big deal. Back to reading. But something is wrong. The concepts that flowed before now resist. You re-read the same paragraph three times. Your mind wanders. You check the time, check email, check anything. Two hours later: little progress, much frustration.

item.title: Diffused Mode: Strategic Breaks for Insight
item.description:
The Problem

You’re stuck. The bug won’t resolve. The architecture decision won’t clarify. The solution hovers at the edge of consciousness—you can feel it, almost grasp it—but the harder you push, the further it recedes. You’ve been at it for two hours. Your eyes blur. Your thinking feels muddy, repetitive, going in circles.

item.title: Interleaving: Mixing for Mastery
item.description:
The Problem

You’re drilling geometry problems. Ten volume problems in a row, then ten surface area problems, then ten Pythagorean theorem problems. Each section feels productive—you get faster, errors drop, confidence builds. You finish feeling fluent.

item.title: Spaced Repetition: The 10-20% Rule for Permanent Memory
item.description:
The Problem

Cramming works—until it doesn’t.

The night-before-the-exam marathon feels productive. You recognize every term. The concepts flow. You walk into the test confident. Three weeks later, it’s as if you never studied.
